channel.title: I need help while making a webclient
channel.description: [i]Okay, first of all - I have everything perfect - I've done this before, but this time, I can't seem to get it. It auto downloads the cache, I made it a jar - But when I run the jar, and try to log in, it just says Error Connecting To Server REALLY quick - And I know what the problem is - I just don't know what to do. Its with EGUI.java - It's not included with the .Jar, therefor it doesn't connect to a server. I'm seriously lost, and I could really use some help. That would be awesome, Thanks.[/i]

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

Yeah, the EGUI isn’t the problem. I don’t know what is. It works when I run it from the .bat file though (because it has EGUI in it)

Read full topic
item.source: I need help while making a webclient

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Sinior_Jube_Head Sinior Jube Head
item.description:
@Sinior_Jube_Head wrote:

Well then either the EGUI.java doesn’t have the right IP put into it to connect to your server (remember after you save it after you change it you have to compile your client to hae the new EGUI.class file…), your server is not being run, or you accidently deleted the EGUI.class from the input directory.

If none of the above, the EGUI isn’t your problem and idk what else it could be.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help while making a webclient

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

I do that - But then I run it, and it doesn’t work. It doesn’t add the EGUI.class in it for some reason.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help while making a webclient

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Sinior_Jube_Head Sinior Jube Head
item.description:
@Sinior_Jube_Head wrote:

Ok I take it you are using JarMaker…

So just if you want to include your EGUI compile your client with the EGUI.java in it… then with JarMaker make the input directory a copy of your client folder with all files except for the .class files deleted, and then finish it off it sounds like you know how to do the rest…

Read full topic
item.source: I need help while making a webclient

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

Because I don’t know how? I can only set one main class, and its client.java - Theres no place where it says I can add other class files.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help while making a webclient

item.title: I need help while making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Sinior_Jube_Head Sinior Jube Head
item.description:
@Sinior_Jube_Head wrote:

If you know it’s with the EGUI then why don’t you just make a new Jar with the EGUI included?

Read full topic

It auto downloads the cache, I made it a jar - But when I run the jar, and try to log in, it just says Error Connecting To Server REALLY quick - And I know what the problem is - I just don’t know what to do. Its with EGUI.java - It’s not included with the .Jar, therefor it doesn’t connect to a server. I’m seriously lost, and I could really use some help. That would be awesome, Thanks.
